member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer
member.summary: Provides an interface for custom drawing of Eyefinder controls.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawContentPaneBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemState)
member.summary: Draws the background of a navigation pane displayed in the content area of the control.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The state of the navigation pane.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawContentPane(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemState,TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane,System.Drawing.Font,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws the foreground artifacts of a navigation pane displayed in the content area of the control.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The state of the navigation pane.
The navigation pane to draw.
The font to use for drawing text.
Whether to draw in right-to-left mode.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawFooterPaneBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemState)
member.summary: Draws the background of a navigation pane displayed in the footer area of the control.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The state of the navigation pane.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawFooterPane(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemState,TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Draws the foreground artifacts of a navigation pane displayed in the content area of the control.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The state of the navigation pane.
The navigaton pane to draw.
The font to use for drawing text.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawHeader(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Image,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws the header at the top of a navigation bar.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The text in the header.
The font to use for drawing text.
The image in the header. This parameter can be null.
Whether to draw in right-to-left mode.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawDivider(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a divider heading.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The text in the header.
The font to use for drawing text.
The foreground colour of the text.
Whether to draw in right-to-left mode.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawGripper(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws the gripper between the client area and buttons.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draws the background of a navigation bar.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The background colour of the control.

remarks.para: Implementors should ensure the entire area specified is drawn. It is safe to use the Graphics.Clear method in this method.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.IEyefinderRenderer.DrawChevron(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draws the chevron glyph in the footer of a navigation bar.
member.param: The Graphics instance to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The colour to draw the chevron.

member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer
member.summary: A renderer that mimics the appearance of Microsoft Office 2003.

member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.RendererBase
member.summary: Provides a base class with useful common functionality for renderers.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.RendererBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RendererBase class.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.RendererBase.Dispose
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.RendererBase.OnSystemColorsChanged
member.summary: Called when the system colours have changed.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.RendererBase.CustomColors
member.summary: Indicates whether custom colours have been used with this renderer.

remarks.para: Some colours are derived from system colours. When they have been changed explicitly, this property is set to true. System colour changes are no longer automatically reflected within the control. To revert to system colours, set this property back to false.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.IMenuRenderer.DrawMenuBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,TD.SandBarInternal.MenuProjection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws the background of a menu.
member.param: The Graphics object to draw with.
The bounds around the area to draw.
The width, in pixels, of the menu margin.
The offset, in pixels, of the break in the menu border.
The size, in pixels, of the break in the menu border.
The direction this menu item is projecting from its parent.
Whether to draw the menu in right-to-left layout.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.IMenuRenderer.DrawMenuItem(System.Drawing.Graphics,TD.SandBarInternal.MenuButtonItem,TD.SandBarInternal.IPopupMenuHost,System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemState,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a menu item.
member.param: The Graphics object to draw with.
The menu item to draw.
The IPopupMenuHost to provide drawing information and services.
The width, in pixels, of the menu margin.
The state of the menu item.
Whether this is an item displayed in a persistant menu.

member.summary: Draws a separator between two menu items.
member.param: The Graphics object to draw with.
The bounds to draw the separator in.
The width, in pixels, of the menu margin.
Whether to draw the separator in right-to-left layout.

The state of the actions button.
Whether the menu is being displayed in design mode.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.ColorScheme
member.summary: The Office 2003 colour scheme used to render navigation bars.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.ShowSpecialHighlightColors
member.summary: Indicates whether or not special orange highlight colours are used instead of the default highlight colour.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.DividerBackgroundColor1
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the start of divider background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.DividerBackgroundColor2
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the finish of divider background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.DividerBorderColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the border above divider headers.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.PaneBackgroundColor1
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the start of navigation pane background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.PaneBackgroundColor2
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the finish of navigation pane background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.HeaderBackgroundColor1
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the start of header background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.HeaderBackgroundColor2
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the finish of header background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.GripperColor1
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the start of gripper background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.GripperColor2
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the finish of gripper background gradients.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.HeaderTextColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw the text in the navigation bar header.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw borders in a navigation bar.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.HighlightColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the colour used to draw button highlights.

remarks.para: This property is only effective when ShowSpecialHighlightColors is set to false.

member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme
member.summary: A colour scheme to be used with the Office 2003 renderer.

member.name: F:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme.Automatic
member.summary: Eyefinder will use the current Windows XP theme if available, otherwise fall back to standard Windows colours.

member.name: F:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme.Standard
member.summary: Eyefinder will use standard windows colours.

member.name: F:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme.LunaBlue
member.summary: Eyefinder will use colours from the Luna Blue theme in Windows XP.

member.name: F:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme.LunaOlive
member.summary: Eyefinder will use colours from the Luna Olive theme in Windows XP.

member.name: F:TD.Eyefinder.Office2003Renderer.Office2003ColorScheme.LunaSilver
member.summary: Eyefinder will use colours from the Luna Silver theme in Windows XP.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ToolbarItemBase class.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.CreateClonedItem
member.summary: Creates a clone of the item.
member.returns: The new item with properties matching the original.

remarks.para: Implementors should create a new instance of the item type.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.CloneItem
member.summary: Creates a copy of the item with the same properties and event bindings.

remarks.para: Implementors should also override CreateClonedItem to ensure the item created is of the correct type. After calling the base method, you should copy all properties and event bindings to the new object before returning it.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ApplyLayout(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the layout boundaries of components within the toolbar item based on the bounds specified.
member.param: The boundaries of the item within its container.
A Graphics object used to calculate metrics on the toolbar.
Whether the toolbar is vertically aligned.
Whether the layout of the object should be right to left.

remarks.para: Once the bounds for an item have been calculated, it knows about the rectangle onscreen that it will occupy. However there may still be layout logic to do - for instance a button must then work out the bounds of its image and text.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Invalidate
member.summary: Causes this item to redraw itself.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of the toolbar item.
member.returns: The new item that is cloned from the original.

remarks.para: This method implements ICloneable, and simply calls the CloneItem method.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.HiddenFromCurrentView
member.summary: Indicates whether the item is hidden from the current view.

remarks.para: This property will return true if the item has been relegated to the chevron menu due to lack of space, or the item cannot be shown in the current orientation.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.MergeAction
member.summary: How to merge this item with the equivalent collection of items on a merge target.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.MergeIndex
member.summary: The index of the matching menu item on the target.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Importance
member.summary: Indicates the importance of this item. Items with lower importance values will be hidden first when short of space.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemImportance
member.summary: Indicates the importance of the item. Items with lower importance are hidden first when short of space.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Padding
member.summary: Gets the padding associated with the toolbar item.

remarks.para: Padding is applied around the edges of a toolbar item. The space added by this padding is used to display the highlight when the item is selected or hovered over.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBar
member.summary: The toolbar this item belongs to.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ButtonBounds
member.summary: The boundaries of this toolbar item, in client coordinates.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ButtonInnerBounds
member.summary: The inner boundaries of this toolbar item, in client coordinates.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Text
member.summary: The text associated with this toolbar item.

remarks.para: Text is usually displayed next to the image or control hosted by the item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the toolbar item is visible.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolTipText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that appears as a ToolTip for the toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is enabled.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.BeginGroup
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will be preceeded by a separator.

member.name: T:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance
member.summary: The importance of a toolbar item within a toolbar.

remarks.para: When the size of a toolbar is not great enough to accommodate all its items, some items disappear. The order in which they disappear can be controlled via item importance. The least important items disappear first, the most important last.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance.Lowest
member.summary: The lowest level of importance.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance.Low
member.summary: A low level of importance.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance.Medium
member.summary: Medium importance. This the default value.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance.High
member.summary: A high level of importance.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ToolBarItemImportance.Highest
member.summary: The highest level of importance.

member.name: T:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemPadding
member.summary: A class representing the padding around a toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemPadding.Top
member.summary: The padding above the toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemPadding.Left
member.summary: The padding to the left of the toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemPadding.Bottom
member.summary: The padding underneath the toolbar item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase.ItemPadding.Right
member.summary: The padding to the right of the toolbar item.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.OnActivate
member.summary: Raises the Activate event.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overridden. Releases the resources associated with the ButtonItemBase.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.CloneItem
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.ApplyLayout(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.LayoutImageAndText(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Lays out the image and text portions of the button within the specified bounds.
member.param: The bounds to contain the image and text.
Whether the item is aligned vertically.
Whether the item is laid out right to left.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ButtonItemBase class.

member.name: E:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.Activate
member.summary: Occurs when the menu item is activated.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.ImageList
member.summary: Gets the imagelist that will provide the images available to the button.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.Checked
member.summary: Indicates the state of the item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index value of the image assigned to the button.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.Image
member.summary: The image assigned to the button.

remarks.para: This property is for direct assignment of images to buttons, without going through an imagelist. This can provide a better model to work with in some cases, and circumvents certain bugs pertaining to loss or corruption of alpha channels with the imagelist component.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.IconSize
member.summary: Gets ot sets the desired icon size to extract from the icon.

remarks.para: Windows icon files can contain more than one size of icon. When an icon file is assigned to a button, this property may need to be changed to ensure that the correct sized icon is extracted from the icon file and drawn.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ButtonItemBase.Icon
member.summary: The icon to show in place of an image.

remarks.para: If alpha-channel information is needed, you may wish to use this property to assign an icon to a button rather than use the ImageList and ImageIndex system.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MenuItemBase class.

member.returns: The user interface for the MenuItem.

member.summary: Determines whether or not a menu item contains any visible children.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether any visible children were found.

member.summary: Raises the BeforePopup event.
member.param: The arguments representing the menu about to be displayed.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.OnAfterPopup(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the menu is dismissed.
member.param: The arguments to be passed to the event (no event is currently implemented).

member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: E:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.BeforePopup
member.summary: Occurs just before a menu is displayed.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.Popup
member.summary: Retrieves the PopupMenu being used to display the menu.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.DefaultChildType
member.summary: Indicates the type of menu item that will be created at design time as a new child of the menu.

remarks.para: The type must derive from MenuButtonItem.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuDirection
member.summary: The direction in which this menu is projecting from its parent.

remarks.para: This property should be used by renderers when deciding how to draw the border of the displayed menu.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.Parent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the menu that contains this menu item.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.ToolTipText
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.HasChildren
member.summary: Indicates whether this menu item has any children.

remarks.para: This property should be used instead of checking the MenuItems.Count property, as the MenuItems collection is created the first time that property is accessed.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.Items
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the collection of menu items associated with the menu.

member.name: T:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuPopupMode
member.summary: Represents the ways in which a menu can be displayed.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuPopupMode.TopLevelMenu
member.summary: The menu is a top-level menu item.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuPopupMode.ContextMenu
member.summary: The menu is being displayed as a context menu over a control.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuPopupMode.SubMenu
member.summary: The menu is a child of another menu.

member.name: T:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.BeforePopupEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the BeforePopup event.

member.summary: A collection of MenuButtonItems belonging to a menu.

member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.AddRange(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase[])
member.summary: Adds an array of toolbar items in to the collection.
member.param: The array of toolbar items to add.

remarks.para: When adding more than one toolbar item at a time you should use this method, as some logic is postponed until after the whole batch has been added, making it more efficient.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.Add(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase)
member.summary: Adds a toolbar item to the collection.
member.param: The toolbar item to add.
member.returns: The new index of the toolbar item in the collection.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.Insert(System.Int32,TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase)
member.summary: Inserts a toolbar item in to the collection at a given offset.
member.param: The position to insert the toolbar item at.
The toolbar item to insert.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.Remove(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase)
member.summary: Removes the specified toolbar item from the collection.
member.param: The toolbar item to remove.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.Contains(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase)
member.summary: Examines the collection to see if it contains the specified toolbar item.
member.param: The toolbar item to look for.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the toolbar item was found.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.IndexOf(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase)
member.summary: Returns the index of a toolbar item in the collection.
member.param: The toolbar item to look for.
member.returns: The index of the toolbar item if found; otherwise -1.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.CopyTo(TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBase[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the contents of the collection in to the given array, starting at the specified offset.
member.param: The array to be copied in to.
The index to start at.

member.name: P:TD.SandBarInternal.ToolbarItemBaseCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the toolbar item at the specified index in the collection.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuItemCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new menu item to the collection, with the specified text.
member.param: The text that will be associated with the new menu item.
member.returns: The new index of the menu item in the collection.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.MenuItemBase.MenuItemCollection.Add(System.String,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Adds a new menu item to the collection, with the specified text and bound to the specified event handler.
member.param: The text that will be associated with the new menu item.
The event handler that will handle the Activate event.
member.returns: The new index of the menu item in the collection.

member.summary: Returns the MenuButtonItem at the specified index.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TopLevelMenuItemBase class.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TopLevelMenuItemBase class, with the specified text.
member.param: The text to associate with this menu item.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.ShowIndependent(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Shows the menu at the specified screen coordinates, without depending on any particular control.
member.param: The position in screen coordinates at which to show the menu.
member.returns: The menu item that was picked by the user. If no menu item was picked, the method returns null.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.Show(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Shows the menu over the specified control, at the specified position.
member.param: The control to display the menu on.
The position to display the menu at, in client coordinates.
member.returns: The menu item that was picked by the user. If no menu item was picked, the method returns null.

remarks.para: This method requires that the menu item belong to a menubar.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.Show(TD.SandBarInternal.IPopupMenuHost,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Shows the menu over the specified control, at the specified position.
member.param: The IPopupMenuHost object that will provide information on how the menu is to be displayed.
The control to display the menu on.
The position to display the menu at, in client coordinates.
member.returns: The menu item that was picked by the user. If no menu item was picked, the method returns null.

remarks.para: This method is the only overload that does not require the menu item to belong to a menubar, since you will have to implement IPopupMenuHost in one of your own classes.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.Show(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows the menu, with keyboard focus if necessary.
member.param: Whether to highlight the first item in the menu for keyboard navigation.
member.returns: The menu item that was picked by the user. If no menu item was picked, the method returns null.

member.name: M:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.Show
member.summary: Shows the menu.
member.returns: The menu item that was picked by the user. If no menu item was picked, the method returns null.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.MenuAnimation.None
member.summary: No animation is performed.

member.name: F:TD.SandBarInternal.TopLevelMenuItemBase.MenuAnimation.System

member.summary: The menu appears to slide in.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.HeaderControl.BuddyPane
member.summary: Associates the HeaderControl with a NavigationPane so that the HeaderControl is only displayed when the NavigationPane is active.

remarks.para: This property eliminates the need to write tedious code to tie up NavigationPane display with an associated HeaderControl. Instead, you can bind the HeaderControl to the NavigationPane in this manner and its visibility will be managed automatically by the control library, at design time as well as runtime.

member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar
member.summary: A bar that contains selectable navigation panes.

remarks.para: A navigation bar contains only one type of control: navigation panes. The navigation bar adds specialised logic to the layout and drawing of these controls to present them accessible via buttons, large and small. How many buttons are visible at any one time is user-configurable.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar.DrawGripper
member.summary: Indicates whether a gripper is drawn that allows the user to change the ShowPanes property visually.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar.Renderer
member.summary: The renderer currently responsible for drawing the control.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar.PaneFont
member.summary: The font to use for drawing the text on the buttons that represent navigation panes.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar.SelectedPane
member.summary: The navigation pane that is currently selected and showing.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationBar.ShowPanes
member.summary: Indicates how many panes to show in the main area of the control.

remarks.para: Of the total number of navigation panes added to the navigation bar, only a certain number may be displayed as large buttons at any one time. This property indicates how many are displayed. It should be a number between zero and the total number of listed panes in the control.

member.name: T:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane
member.summary: Extends the Control class to provide members needed to resemble a navigation pane.

remarks.para: Only controls of this type can be added to the NavigationBar. This class exposes members such as LargeImage and SmallImage to give Navigation Panes the look and feel needed.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NavigationPane class.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.OnEnabledChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: M:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.OnForeColorChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.Listed
member.summary: Indicates whether the Navigation Pane is listed in the visual part of the Navigation Bar.

remarks.para: When a pane is not listed it can only be accessed via the chevron menu of the navigation bar. Using this menu, the user can control which panes are visible and which are not. This is useful for hiding panes the user feels they will rarely use.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.LargeImage
member.summary: A 24x24 pixel image representing the navigation pane.

remarks.para: This image is used to represent the navigation pane in the main area of the navigation bar. It can also be used to represent the pane in the condensed area at the bottom of the navigation bar if no small image is available.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.SmallImage
member.summary: A 16x16 pixel image representing the navigation pane.

remarks.para: This image is used to represent the navigation pane in the condensed area at the bottom of the navigation bar, and also in the chevron menu when there is not enough space to display the image normally.

member.name: P:TD.Eyefinder.NavigationPane.Text
member.summary: Overridden.
